message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with computer vision tasks such as action localization and human detection, which are typically covered under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also introduces a novel approach for weakly-supervised learning, which involves the use of multiple instance learning (MIL) and improved dense trajectories, which are techniques that are commonly used in machine learning (cs.LG) and multimedia (cs.MM) research. Additionally, the paper discusses the creation of a new dataset for action localization, which involves the annotation of videos, a task that is related to information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
